data.title: Wiktionary, the free dictionary
data.text:
Arabic: إحْرَاج m (ʔiḥrāj)

Belarusian: збянтэ́жанасць f (zbjantéžanascʹ), со́рам m (sóram)

Bulgarian: притеснение (bg) n (pritesnenie), стеснение (bg) n (stesnenie)

Catalan: avergonyiment m

Dutch: verlegenheid (nl) f

Finnish: kiusaantuneisuus, nolostuminen (fi), häpeä (fi)

French: embarras (fr) m

German: Verlegenheit (de) f, Peinlichkeit (de) f, Betretenheit f

Hindi: शर्म (hi) f (śarm), शर्मिंदगी f (śarmindgī)

Italian: imbarazzo (it)

Kurdish:

Central Kurdish: تەریقی (terîqî)

Maori: aniutanga, aniutanga

Norwegian: sjenerthet, sjenanse, forlegenhet (no), unnselighet, unnseelse

Polish: zażenowanie (pl) n

Portuguese: vergonha (pt) f

Romanian: jenă (ro) f

Russian: смуще́ние (ru) n (smuščénije), стесне́ние (ru) n (stesnénije), стыд (ru) m (styd)

Sardinian:

Campidanese: barrancu

Sicilian: mpicciu m

Spanish: vergüenza (es) f, corte m (Spain, colloquial), bochorno (es), pena f (Caribbean Islands, Central America, Colombia, Mexico, Venezuela - colloquial), plancha m (Chile, colloquial), pudor m (especially Argentina, Chile, Uruguay - formal usage in other countries), roche m (Peru, colloquial)

Tagalog: dalang-hiya

Ukrainian: збенте́ження n (zbentéžennja), со́ром m (sórom)

Yiddish: שאַנדע f (shande)
